channel.title: (Solved by myself)Order of operations with fractions
channel.description:
Question was
1/6 x 3/4 + 5/12 divided by 1/18th
My answer was 15/2 (Had to reduce.)
How is this wrong?
I went over it like 5 times and I still get the same answer.
1/6 x 3/4 + 5/12 divided by 1/18th
1/6 x 3/4 = 1/8
1/8 + 5/12 divided by 1/18th
5/12 divided by 1/18th = 15/2
1/8 + 15/2 = [s]60/8[/s]
I see now its 61/8 i forgot to add the one, as so
1/8 + 15/2
1/8 + 60/8
61/8
Such a simple mistake

item.title: (Solved by myself)Order of operations with fractions
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I realise that you’re trying to be a positive poster in this community, however the questions you post are somewhat basic maths questions that don’t really need that much effort to solve. If you have more problems with questions like these, I suggest creating one topic for all of them.

Read full topic

item.title: (Solved by myself)Order of operations with fractions
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“llcoolchris, post:5, topic:459720”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=562625.msg4102121#msg4102121 date=1347618622]

Before you post on the forums, work on it for a little bit more by myself. We don’t need these section filled with posts of you solving problems that you don’t even need help on.

I did need help on it, and piss off mod wanna be.

lmao. You obviously didn’t need help on it since 20 minutes after you posted this topic you figured it out.
[/quote]

Exactly 20 minutes afterwards and i spent about 30 minutes before then trying to figure out what was wrong. Posting on a help section on a forum is to get help but it doesn’t mean you sit there pushing refresh, instead I kept working on it, eventually figured it out. Get off my topics .[/quote]

You could just look in your math book, see what you were doing wrong, and have it fixed in 10 minutes. Then there wouldn’t even be a need to post on here.

And one last thing, who really looks like the dick here?

llcoolchris (+10/-29) vManlyMan (+10/-199) -1 dick - mscp In topic Today at 06:17:15 AM

Read full topic

item.title: (Solved by myself)Order of operations with fractions
item.dc:creator: @llcoolchris llcoolchris
item.description:
@llcoolchris wrote:

Question was

1/6 x 3/4 + 5/12 divided by 1/18th

My answer was 15/2 (Had to reduce.)

How is this wrong?

I went over it like 5 times and I still get the same answer.

1/6 x 3/4 + 5/12 divided by 1/18th

1/6 x 3/4 = 1/8

1/8 + 5/12 divided by 1/18th

5/12 divided by 1/18th = 15/2

1/8 + 15/2 = 60/8

I see now its 61/8 i forgot to add the one, as so

1/8 + 15/2

1/8 + 60/8

61/8

Such a simple mistake
